reviews.text: Booked this hotel through a hostel website but was glad it was really a hotel as we got fresh towels and a private room. Staff was friendly and breakfast was actually really good for bread and coffee. Great balcony where you had an excellent view of a Parisian neighbourhood. Walking distance to Anvers subway station. Room was clean, along with the public washrooms we had to rely on as we did not have a toilet or shower in our room, however we also never had to wait to use these facilities. Beds were however on the small side, and is definitely one of the tackiest rooms I have ever stayed in. Overall, this hotel is a great value for your money.
reviews.title: Great Hostel that turned out to be a Hotel

likes.disliked: — Having to share a pillow...they used one really long pillow rather than using two smaller pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very happy with the hotel we had a double en-suite room it was basic but good for the price. Excellent location, friendly staff and breakfast included. I would happily use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Perfect for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with helpful and nice staff. Quiet and great location (5min walk to nearest metro-station, 10min walk to Sacre Ceur). Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast is the only drawback as it is just a piece of bread and som jam, but concidering the low price of the rooms, you could and should afford yourself some proper breakfast at a bakery or a supermarked (you'll find both very close to the hotel.)
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in January 2006. This place is great if you are on a budget - sure, the decor is a bit dated and the rooms aren't spacious by any means, but you get what you pay for! we had an ensuite room for only a couple of euros more, booked via Hostels, which was much better than having to use the communal bathroom. The staff on reception were always friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: great cheap budget hotel
alright if you're on a budget...
reviews.text: As noted by a previous poster the breakfasts are very simple - bagette bread and jam with coffee (no other variations at all), but you don't have to take them since there are plenty of little boulangeries and cafes about to get something a bit easier on the teeth! we would heartily recommend the little patisserie/cafe at the foot of the steps up to the Sacre Coeur (about a 15 min walk from the hotel) - their extra special breakfast is *huge* and will defeat even the biggest eater (fresh orange juice and hot chocolate, a range of fresh bread/pastry products and bacon with eggs!)

reviews.title: Great!!!
reviews.text: We found the best time to explore the seedier parts of Montmarte (ie. where the Moulin Rouge is, amongst the sex shops) was Sunday morning when its absolutely deserted - the only places really open at that time are the bakeries!
